fr.unilim.javance.projet.model.mock
Class MockTodoManager

java.lang.Object
  fr.unilim.javance.projet.model.mock.MockTodoManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
TodoManager
public class MockTodoManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements TodoManager

A TodoManager mock implementation A naive implementation of the TodoManager interface. It means that this implementation is not proof of bugs. We encourage you to fix it and make pull requests during the project. We would not take support if anything is wrong. Compared to the attempted implementation, it does not use threads (objects are cached in memory), inputs are not verified etc. Obviously, you can extend this class to meet your requirements. To use such a class, you have to register listeners to obtain the result of the operation. All objects are stored in memory, there is no persistence (ie. when restarting the application you will have a "blank" configuration).

Author:
Amaury Gauthier, David Pequegnot
See Also:
TodoManager, TodoListener, MockFolderCache, MockTaskCache

Method Detail

launchAuthenticationProcess

public void launchAuthenticationProcess(Context context)
Launch the authentication process to access the backend No authentication is needed in our schema. So listeners are notified with an empty (null) Activity. Call: onAuthenticationRequest and onAuthenticationStatusChanged

Specified by:
launchAuthenticationProcess in interface TodoManager

getAuthenticationStatus

public void getAuthenticationStatus()
Get the authentication status In this implementation, the user is already authenticated. Thus, the listener already receives true for the authentication status. Call: onAuthenticationStatusChanged

Specified by:
getAuthenticationStatus in interface TodoManager

fillFolder

public void fillFolder(Folder folder)
Fill or create a folder Create a folder if the given folder in parameter has no identifier (empty or null). Else, it will fill folder's tasks with their values. Call: onFillFolder
